website_summaries.verdict: Achieve consistent, high-quality coffee grounds in seconds with this sturdy, reliable grinder.
pros: This heavy, well-built coffee grinder stays easily in place on the counter
Includes countdown timer and auto-shutoff features
Grind quality is consistent from fine to coarse and everything in between
We found the Virtuoso to be fast and considerably quiet
Grinder is easy to use with clearly marked grind settings
cons: Included instructions are vague, but detailed help is available online

customer_reviews.title: A maintenance nightmare to be avoided at all costs
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: Please see my review posted on the Virtuoso+ product for an updated review after having lived with this abominable machine for a while now. Avoid this poorly-designed maintenance nightmare like the plague it is.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Thom

customer_reviews.title: The Baratza Virtuoso does a great job grinding coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: The Baratza Virtuoso does a great job grinding coffee beans. Unfortunately the units seem to die on a regular basis. I've owned two of these and they both have quit working. The second unit only lasted 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Durham

customer_reviews.title: Too coarse for espresso
customer_reviews.text: The finest setting is too coarse for espresso. The manual doesn't say how to fix the problem. Found a video on the internet that explains how to recalibrate the grinder. It involves removing the covers, using a tiny Phillips screwdriver, etc. Too much hassle for such an expensive grinder. It went back in the box and back to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Szekely

customer_reviews.title: Broken After 1.5 Years of Light Use
customer_reviews.text: Followed all manufacturers directions, used only a couple of times a week, dead after 1.5 years. I used to be a Barista, understand how to use + care for grinders. Emailed company, mostly likely will use out of warranty excuse for not fixing. This thing is junk, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: RAP

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee grinder after reviewing many online reviews, however, It did not meet my expectation at all. Stopped working after 2 months. At first, the coffee powder won't come out, after I cleaned the hole, the powder did come out, however, the size of the particle is huge, even when I set it around 5. The worst, it requires 20% of restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: Yun Z.

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 2 years -- Quality issues / Support issues/ ... and not 'user repairable'
customer_reviews.text: The motor failed after 2 years. Graciously, the company sent a replacement motor. Unfortunately, the motor is attached by torx screws and requires a special bit to unscrew the attachments. It is disappointing that the company claims the grinder is 'user repairable' and then uses an attachment which is far from anything most people would have in their tool box. The grinder when it works is terrific. However, I cannot justify spending over $200 for a grinder which breaks in 2 years. Advice to the company: -- Use better parts .. the plastic gears and weak motor are cutting it -- Avoid torx attachments -- Follow through on your commitments to make the grinder repairable.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: I started using my Baratza Virtuoso on November 19, grinding the equivalent of one pot of coffee per day. Today, December 5, it died on me. I’m so disappointed,since I really did some research on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jczar

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is amazing. BUT
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is amazing. BUT, one thing you have to do is make absolutely sure that the red tab on the inner Removable Ring Burr is positioned at 5 o'clock. Mine was shipped with the red tab at 11 o'clock and the grind was way too coarse. Once properly positioned, the grind is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder because it was recommended by a local coffee spot. It stopped working after a couple of months. We contacted the company but they would not accept a return or honor the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 1 year!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 18 months. Replacements only covered for one year. Worked great while it lasted but for $230 it should last at least a decade. It’s obviously built with plastic crap. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: While the quality of the grind is truly excellent, all the reviews that complain about very poor ...
customer_reviews.text: While the quality of the grind is truly excellent, all the reviews that complain about very poor seal between the cup and the grinder causing a simply ridiculous amount of grounds to collect all around the grinder are true. I didn't want to believe that a $200 grinder could have a design flaw this bad, but believe it. I will give their customer service 5 stars for fixing a different problem immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mid-Level Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This unit produces a very even grind over a wide range of settings. I brew in a drip machine (Moccamaster) or a pour-over dripper (V60) and the grind adjustments work very well for those devices. I don't brew espresso so I have no need for the micro-adjustments in grind size that serious baristas use to fine tune their shots. If that's your interest, there are many alternatives for your consideration. I like the low retention of grounds and the lack of static - almost no cleanup required other than periodic washing if the hopper and grind bin.
customer_reviews.author: B. Franz

customer_reviews.title: Zero Issues - Great Coffee - Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Was kinda "meh" at at first (wish some of the plastics were less cheap feeling) but but the more I used it, the better I liked it. The metal chassis is very sturdy and has some heft to it. If I'm being really being picky about it, I think the power cord could be made with higher quality natural rubber at this price point. It's easy to clean, consistent grind (for the money) and most importantly: not disposable and built to be serviced for many years of use. Spare parts are easty to find if you need them. I use with a Chemex between 22-24, white paper filters.
customer_reviews.author: Internet

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this grinder for over a year and had great results - it grinds to perfection. The unit is loud when used but that is expected from a grinder - it has multiple settings from course too fine. Like other mention grinds get all over due to the static charge produce during grinding (they stick to the sides of the dispenser cup and fall off creating a small mess around the unit - this does not bother me. The only negative to me for the price is the unit is all plastic seems like lower quality when i unpacked it but that doesn't effect the grinds that come out - great burr grinder
customer_reviews.author: SGP

customer_reviews.title: Compact and effective
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a commercial grinder that I had used since 1976. (Grinder still worked well but dispenser jammed and couldn't be repaired.) Baratza lacks the nearly infinite adjustability of the old grinder, but I can adapt by adjusting my pressure packing the coffee into the portecafe. After only two months I can't judge durability, but the grinder seems well made, and it's easy to use and not excessively noisy. The spring loaded timer is a nice feature that allows one to do other things while the grinder does its job. It will be interesting to see how long that spring lasts.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bode

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is absolutely wonderful!! And beautiful on my countertop!! It far exceeds the quality of my other $100.00 "Capresso Infinity" grinder! (Which broke a few weeks ago (after repeated daily use for a few years) I thought I was happy with my Capresso grinder (my first venture using an electric machine) until I used this new one!!! There is no comparison in quality! The Baratza is fabulous for the price and feels and looks very high end, without breaking the bank!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey A. Hash

customer_reviews.title: Great design & performance ... replacement parts easily available
customer_reviews.text: Baratza's Encore and Virtuoso bean grinders often win the comparison tests. Two reasons are (1) the low speed DC motor does not overheat the beans (2) they use precision burr grinders produced in Europe. And, unlike most consumer appliances, they are not built for obsolescence: Baratza encourages customers to refurbish older machines by selling replacement parts and providing detailed instructions & videos on their website. We couldn't be more pleased with the Virtuoso (has a faster burr grinder than Encore and adds nice looking brushed stainless trim) and are getting an even, consistent espresso grind on the "5" setting. It's also very quiet and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Highly Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The best feature, of this brand and line of grinders, is their self-service ability. Burr grinders invariably require service and parts, at some point in time, and this company readily supplies replacement-parts and support. They have posted many detailed YouTube videos, toward this end. This grinder feels well made and very durable, also. That being said; we've used this model for years, now, with absolutely no issues, for both drip and espresso machines. We don't notice the grind-noise, and are happy with the anti-static ground-catchers. The grinder is not "messy", though we keep it on a grinder-tray.
customer_reviews.author: Putnam Wright

customer_reviews.title: Not very loud at all, grinds great.
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder, not too loud. I live in Denver CO where it’s dry so maybe that is why when I empty the container, many of the grounds stick to the top of it and I have to use my fingers to scrape out the grinds. (Static). That then also makes a mess, so I empty the container to the coffee ground container, inside a plastic bag. Other reviews said it was a little messy, which it is, but this is not a reason to buy it. I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ed K

customer_reviews.title: A really good coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a Cuisinart burr/blade grinder that broke after several years of use. I expect this grinder to last even longer; it's more stoutly built while having a smaller footprint. It also produces a nice, uniform grind at auto-drip settings, and is significantly quieter than my older grinder. The mechanical timer also means I don't over-grind as much, which is a nice feature. I'm really happy with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer7

customer_reviews.title: super high quality
customer_reviews.text: used to have a $50 cuisinart 'burr grinder'. compared to this unit from Baratza, that piece of garbage isn't in the same league. it's not even the same sport. super consistent grind size. very easy to use. i'm glad i upgraded to this model with the timer switch. just turn that dial to the same spot every time and get the right amount of grounds for a pot.
customer_reviews.author: bill mavredes

customer_reviews.title: Got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.text: Instead of describing my experience in the past 6 months since I upgraded from the Encore to the Virtuoso, I will describe my experience with Baratza products. I owned the Baratza Encore, used it over 700 times over 5 years, replaced two small parts they sell for $12, and sold it for 50% of what I originally paid. That makes me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Improved Coffee Taste with Consistent Grind
customer_reviews.text: So far, has been a welcome addition to my home "coffee bar". I would like to see the on-off dial on the front rather than the side. Wish it didn't create a small mess every time I used it, but I believe static electricity is the culprit. Most important,I think my coffee actually tastes better using this rather than my old grinder.
customer_reviews.author: C. Soberman

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder EVER
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grinder to replace a weak grinder at our office. It is amazing! The grinds come out perfectly and makes the best cup of coffee. Everyone in the office has commented on how the same beans we've been using are no longer bitter. I am so happy with the Virtuoso that I have purchased one for our home.
customer_reviews.author: On line buyer in CA

customer_reviews.title: Timer broke in the grinder on position after 5 days ...
customer_reviews.text: Timer broke in the grinder on position after 5 days of morning coffee , this should last 20 years. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Simply dies and stays dead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one unit, and it failed within the warranty period. The company sent me a replacement and it failed too. In both cases the unit simply stopped doing anything when the start button was pushed. I suspect bad electronics. The grind quality was good when it worked. I won't buy another.
customer_reviews.author: T Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder. Read every review, and this was expensive, but the very best. Coffee tastes 100% better using this grinder. I wish I'd bought it a long time ago. I'm very picky about my coffee. Nothing is as good as coffee from the $5K machine made by a professional barista, but this grinder is as good as it gets at home.
customer_reviews.author: Fly By Night

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple months now and it functions very well. I'm tinkering with the mechanical timer for proper grind amount instead of manually holding the grind button down. Does a great job and noticeable coffee quality over my old blade grinder. Durability is 4 stars because it's still new. Versatility? I only make drip so who knows?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service
customer_reviews.text: Baratza has the best customer service! The true measure of a company is how they stand by their product. Mine stopped working about a 14 months after I bought it. Despite it being out of warranty, the support folks diagnosed the problem and shipped me a new motor. The instructions were surprisingly easy to follow (I am not handy at all) and my grinder is now working well again. The forums were right... Baratza is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Epee Fencer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Needs: 1. Larger bean hopper so unground beans will last beyond two pots of coffee 2. Conductive/metal grounds drawer to eliminate the static clinging grounds that inevitably end up on counter and floor and sink etc. 3. Sound insulation. While not as ear splitting as a blender the sound level is annoying. 4. Marking label around timer knob to reproduce results.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetmaster

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT for GREAT coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! We have been using an electric blade grinder for our coffee and this burr grinder made a huge, wonderful difference. It does a very nice fine grind in a short amount of time. The coffee tastes much smoother but still nice and strong. We liked it so much we bought a second one to have at the cabin. EXCELLENT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinder

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee grinder. I love the look and quality of the grind. This clogged for me within the 1st 3 months but a quick search of You Tube videos walked me through the cleaning process easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel2450

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I started with a refurbished baratza encore grinder, far superior to the little bean grinder I had been using. It gave up the ghost after ten years and I bought this. Big step up and it has been worth every penny. If you care about coffee but are still minding the dollars, this has been the perfect compromise for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Baratza coffee grinders are worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: My old coffee grinder went missing during a recent relocation so I ordered a new one as a replacement. The new Baratza Virtuoso is far superior.....the motor is more consistent even though it is a bit noisier. Great product that helps make a great cup of coffee every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Oak of my generation

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality. Worked well when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Poor Quality. Worked well when it worked. Stopped working after 6 months. Not acceptable for a two hundred dollar grinder
customer_reviews.author: Prest871

customer_reviews.title: Very Consistent Grinder. Great email support
customer_reviews.text: It's an amazingly professional level of grind for the price. I've had mine for 2+ years using it multiple times per day and wouldn't trade back down for anything. In addition, my brother in law forced/broke the timer knob, and they have GREAT instructions on how to take it all apart and replace individual pieces. We were able to fix it with just the tools lying around the house. Baratza support might actually be best thing about this product(and all their products).
customer_reviews.author: Nilla

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only 9 months!
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it worked. We were very pleased with its appearance and function. But to spend this much on a coffee grinder described as being built like commercial grinders and have it day with relatively light home use is unacceptable. We shall see if they stand behind their product. I am not optimistic as I see not reviews with good resolution.
customer_reviews.author: nancy working mom

customer_reviews.title: I read that they are very good at supplying replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: been using every day for 2 years to grind about 2 ounces of coffee. it is relatively quite and very consistent in grind size. when mine craps out, I will either get a replacement part for the crapped out part or get a new one. I read that they are very good at supplying replacement parts. I just love my grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Jake E

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, well built, easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is really quiet. The only annoyance is that the coffee grinds seem to get under the container and on the counter. However, that seems to be due to static electricity. Baratza support recommends waiting 15 seconds and tapping the container to avoid that. That seems to work. Easy to use. Still giving 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Works Great When Set Up Correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Once set up correctly, this grinder provides very consistent results. Reasonably quiet when compared with blade bean choppers. Too soon to assess durability. Ours came with the ring burr installed incorrectly, making the grind too coarse. The red tab on the plastic ring burr holder must be aligned with the notch in the black detent ring when it is rotated fully counter-clickwise. This information is in the manual available from the Baratza site.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Donovan

customer_reviews.title: When it was working the fine grind was magnificent
customer_reviews.text: I've has it just over a year... It just died. When it was working the fine grind was magnificent, but the operation a bit clunky. Loud... Yes I can handle that. Messy... Ok, yes and that was annoying. The worsy part, beans are constantly caught inside the grinder around the edge and need constant cleaning. I wouldn't but it again at this price, a nice product but bot for this design and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: No Reason

customer_reviews.title: Great quality coffee bean grinder!
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived quickly, in good condition and as described by seller. Although pricey, I am very happy with this purchase and I would buy from them again. I did a lot of research on grinders before I made this purchase. The grinder is made of quality materials, grinds the beans easily, and is not too loud during operation. I like the simple dials for operation, the overall weight of the machine, and it looks great on our counter! I have to say, this grinder makes the whole coffee making ritual a wonderful experience EVERY morning. I highly recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Coolrunner

customer_reviews.title: Cannot grind fine.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in that at the finest setting, it is too course for espresso or mellita (pour over). Wish I had returned it while I could.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: quiet for a grinder, even coffee grounds, easy to use, looks good. Cons: installing the gasket is a little awkward, kind of expensive, tall (but still fits under the cabinet), excess cord lays out on the counter (no place to wind it under the base)
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend this product and personally will never purchase anything with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this expensive grinder a little bit over a year ago. It died today, after calling customer service they said they couldn't do anything because it was out of warranty. So we paid $229 for the use of a coffee grinder for just over a year. Would NOT recommend this product and personally will never purchase anything with Baratza brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, even for drip coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I make only drip coffee, and had looked at the Virtuoso for a long time, but felt it was overkill. Was I wrong. Everything about this machine is better built than the basic Maestro and well worth the price. Amazon reviews helped me make the right decision-- at least for me. It's relatively quiet for a grinder; you don't need a timer if you just measure the amount of coffee first, and yes, a few particles remain in the hopper-- but so what.
customer_reviews.author: SarasotaLady

customer_reviews.title: Baratza coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these grinders and find them to be far superior to other brands. The burs have to be cleaned periodically but that is not difficult as the enclosed booklet has instructions. It is quiet in comparison to other types of coffee grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Ardell

customer_reviews.title: Bought in Feb.. broke by Nov of same year
customer_reviews.text: Totally stopped working. Tried everything they said to do as jamming is common. But couldn't get it to work. My guy took a go at it and he couldn't get it to work either and he's usually pretty good at these sorts of things. So nada. No I will try to send back.
customer_reviews.author: kg1

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Hario mini mill before (which I considered a great grinder) the consistency of the Virtuoso is insane. At least in the pourover range the quality of the grind has a noticeable effect on the final cup of coffee. Very easy to set up out of the box. Loud, but not nearly as loud as a blade grinder; if I'm only doing enough for one cup I can run it in the morning without worrying about waking up the neighbors and my roommate.
customer_reviews.author: amadden

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it unless you enjoy cleaning with each use
customer_reviews.text: Get horribly clogged after 2-3 uses, and the cleaning brush is too small and inflexible to be useful. No matter what courseness setting you dial in, it’s always super fine. Terrible for French Press or Aeropress. After a year of use (1-2x per week), I’m ready for something different.
customer_reviews.author: I Know

customer_reviews.title: Motor failed after 10 months of light duty. Only one year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Motor failed to start after about 10 months of use. Duty cycle was once a day one 12 cup pot of coffee. Problem was a dead pole on motor. Removing a few parts allows access to rotate the motor slightly. The motor would then work properly for a few starts, then repeat the whole process. Am ordering a new $40 replacement motor. Will update experience when repairs are completed.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: I am just not understanding the hype on this unit. The grind was almost always uneven, and then the unit stopped working entirely after about a year. Quite upset about this... perhaps I received a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: J-OJ

customer_reviews.title: An amazing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to all who reviewed this coffee grinder as I base many of my purchases on these comments. I was blown away with how solid this machine is and the versatility of the many grind settings. I used a blade grinder for many years without knowing that burr grinders were better at producing a more uniform grind and ultimately a better cup of coffee. Burr grinders are significantly higher in price and I was reluctant to make the investment in this product but I'm so happy I did. The Baratza Virtuoso absolutely knocks it out of the park!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: ... is my first conical grinder after years with a horrible blade grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is my first conical grinder after years with a horrible blade grinder! To that extent it's excellent. My only gripe is that there is quite a bit of excess ground beans held in the shoot by static electricity. Removing the hopper causes them to fall out and make a mess. Shaking the grinder after it finishes helps...but defn a design flaw. Hard to know if this could be fixed. Till then I'll gladly clean up the counter over wasting my beautiful beans in that gross blade grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L York

customer_reviews.title: Solid User Serviceable Grinder
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of coffee grounds are left in the output chute and they fall down into the crevices when you pull the canister out. The coarse grind doesn't seem particularly even, but I don't know if other grinders can do better. It's very user serviceable, quiet compared to the Capresso Infinity, fairly easy to clean. Can't comment on robustness yet (I've only had it for 2 months).
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, Baratza and Seattle coffee gear both have ...
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder, Baratza and Seattle coffee gear both have amazing customer service and support. S.C.G. is a wonderful place to satisfy any and all of your​ coffee equipment needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mindful Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: I feel better every morning because, now, my morning coffee is better.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. My coffee is better because this produces a uniform grind and does not heat up the coffee the way my old Bosch Coffee Chopper did. I also use it set to its finest setting to grind coffee for my personal Rub Recipe. My Wife's original comment was, " You paid how much for this contraption?" Now she loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: bobh

customer_reviews.title: I am not a coffee connoisseur. That said...
customer_reviews.text: ...after three months of almost everyday use, I'm very satisfied. It has a fine look to it, subtle curves and brushed stainless accents with a bronze undertone. Quality fit and finish. It's easy to use. Turn a collar at the base of the bean hopper to set fineness of grind, from espresso to french roast. It grinds at a relatively slow pace, even a bit more slowly when set course, 30+ or so on the adjustment sleeve. It's not exactly quiet but not to noisy for me. Overall the grind is uniform with very little dust. This burr grinder does its part in making a very good cup of coffee. Very solid, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Delivers
customer_reviews.text: When my last burr grinder died, I really wanted to find one that promised less static, along with having the ability to adjust ground size for different brews. I was skepticle that the promises of less static was possible, but this truly is better. Not perfect - there is still the occasional dusting of grounds around the edge of the catch chamber, but no more leaping of grounds covering my hand and counter! Others have written good reviews of the cleaning and maintenance to keep this grinder performing ideally. It's easy. I also like the weight and sturdy construction. I'm sure I'll have this grinder of a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Bartimole

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: For the first 8 months it was a 5 star it now has stopped working. I will now see how good is their customer service. Need to update this review. I was sent a new unit almost immediately and have been using it at least once a day without any issues. It works great. If interested the NY Times did an article on coffee and compared this unit to a $1000+ grinder saying it was as good as the much higher priced unit. I agree
customer_reviews.author: bobk

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Reliable grinder for grinding from French press to pressurized portafilter. The repair-ability and availability of parts is a major plus!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the grind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder after trying a more expensive one and I hate it! I wish I had returned it right away. I have coffee grounds on my counter top and I’m not impressed with the grind! I purchase my coffee beans on line from just coffee and I have a Melitta in AZ and my coffee is great! They no longer have that grinder so am now looking for something else as I am not happy with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Kenning

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Quick, easy, relatively quiet, easy to clean. Also grinds beans to uniform size. Recommended a lot by professional coffee grinders for noncommercial use. Now I see why. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bartleby

customer_reviews.title: Repeatable grind and first rate build quality
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but works! I hope the timer knob and timer last as expected. There is no way to set the timer,hit or miss; use a gram scale for accurate dosage.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bates

customer_reviews.title: Worth getting if you care about your coffee
customer_reviews.text: Have had this grinder for one month with no problems whatsoever. A great improvement over my old whirly blade grinder. Very glad I finally have it after hesitating a long time. I think it is worth getting over the Encore.The little timer button on the side is nice to have. Quality and customer service seems excellent, so as long as it lasts like I expect it to this is a solid investment. Coffee is a big part of my life!
customer_reviews.author: oppressedproletariat

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful grinder
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I cannot give it 5 Stars is that it does create a little mess on the counter. Otherwise a wonderful grinder, and I particularly like the availability of well priced manufacturer original replacement parts. But suspect it will be years before I need any of those. Solid grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Taute

customer_reviews.title: Not so great.

customer_reviews.author: Neurad1

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I had researched coffee grinders a few months ago, but since I didn't need a new grinder at that point and chose not to buy one at that time. An unplanned test of my old grinder's ability to drop 4 feet to a tiled floor wasn't a success. I went with the most promising of the grinders I had looked at and I have been quite satisfied with my choice
customer_reviews.author: bilbert79

customer_reviews.title: Everything you'd expect in a high-quality conical burr grinder, good price
customer_reviews.text: Has enough settings to accomodate fine-tuning grind for espresso and for drip coffee. Have had no issues with the design which is simple and easy-to-clean. Produces a precision grind for quality coffee.
customer_reviews.author: S MILLER

customer_reviews.title: !!! READ THIS !!!
customer_reviews.text: expensive grinder for home use? maybe. worth it OFY! without a doubt makes a consistent grind and completely changed how much I can enjoy making my own coffee
customer_reviews.author: Jameswk

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good!
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I have been using this steadily for the past 3 weeks and love it. We are new to home espresso drinks, but we do not have amateurs' palettes (especially my partner who is a whiny snob about his espresso). The espressos have turned out really well. It took a weekend or two of playing around with settings but the machine is easy to use, effective, and not too loud. If it holds up well and churns out consistent grind, I'll upgrade to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: S. Park

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: After many years of cheap chopping grinders that did a mediocre job and eventually gave out, I splurged on a real grinder and couldn't be happier. Gives me a real course grind for my french-press and great fine grind for my espresso machine. Love the consistency and the fact that it just grinds away. Only thing I could wish for would be a better mechanism for the pulse-grind filling my espresso basket; hard to gauge when I'm done and it generally gets a bit messy.
customer_reviews.author: Marathon Trainer

customer_reviews.title: ... time researching burr coffee grinders and I am very pleased with the Baratza Virtuoso
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching burr coffee grinders and I am very pleased with the Baratza Virtuoso. The unit feels seems to be well constructed, it's very easy to use, and I enjoy the variety of grind settings it offers. After 6 months of use, I am happy with this product. The grinder is a little heavy, which I think speaks to the quality of materials used to construct it.
customer_reviews.author: LSF

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but messy
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee grinder. Quiet operation. One drawback however is that the container that holds grounds builds a lot of static cling that disburses grounds so you are constantly needing to clean up coffee grounds in and around machine
customer_reviews.author: A.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have owed this grinder for 4 years and use multiple times a day. It’s held up extremely well, the coarseness of the grind is really uniform as well.
customer_reviews.author: Logan D.

customer_reviews.title: ground perfect pour over coffee
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 2016. Motor malfunction December 2017. Used at home twice a week on the weekends. Prior to technical difficulties, ground perfect pour over coffee. For the price, I expected greater longevity and quality with such infrequent usage
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: I read through a bunch of reviews in Amazon and other portal, but still wasn't quite sure if it's a good choice. I was specially concerned about the mess is supposedly leaves behind. But I have to admit - there is no mess. It's all about how steady hands you have when grinding directly into porta filter. Really, there is no trouble, it has very nice consistent grind.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Koppel

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder but a messy grinder
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 10 year old Solis Maestro grinder with this. It is a great grinder that I feel will last forever. The problem with this is the mess of grounds you will have because of static electricity. I don't mind the mess and I don't believe you will find a grinder, that is built this well, in this price range. This thing is heavy, has professional burs and a powerful motor and some of the best customer service you will ever get if you should need to contact Baratza.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Runions

customer_reviews.title: This coffee grinder did not grind my coffee at all finely no matter what grind I set it to.

customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Great!!! A little staticky
customer_reviews.text: Great all around! I’m only taking one star off for the static build up. Some models have anti-static but I wasn’t willing to pay an extra couple hundred dollars just for that. Otherwise we love this grinder!
customer_reviews.author: CampianA

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well for a year
customer_reviews.text: We've had this grinder for a little less than a year and it has completely quit working. When it did work it was fantastic. The warranty only covers parts so we're contemplating whether or not it's worth fixing but we were really hoping it would last longer. we finally took the time to talk to their service department and they were great to deal with and we were able to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous to move to the prosumer market, however, I'm sorry I didn't do it sooner. I find that compared to my cheaper Burr grinder, the Baratza Virtuoso is much quieter, faster and consistent. And I love the drop thru feature where I can catch the grind live in a small container to transfer it to my Aeropress. I used to hand grind for consistency and one Aeropress cup took 2-3 min of hand grinding. Now I can get that in 7 seconds :)
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great burr coffee grinder

customer_reviews.title: I've had it for about a month and I am quite pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: this replaced my prior Virtuoso grinder which I have had for close to 15 years. The old one still works, unless the setting on the grinder is 40 or above for the grinder. This newer version seems to have less fines than the prior one, it is also louder and grinds about twice as fast. It fixed the old dropping of the knob issue (not really a big deal for me). I've had it for about a month and I am quite pleased with it. shipped from kitchen kapers which is an awesome store and webstore.

customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great BUT don't overfill bin
customer_reviews.text: Great item BUT do not fill canister its capacity (as shown in picture) because grounds will likely exceed the dispenser canister capacity and clog the small output channel--it is a real pain to clear the obstruction with a long paper clip as the website instructs you to do, especially if you use beans high in oil. Why the manufacturer has not either used a smaller bin for beans or at least a suggested "fill line" on it is beyond me. That is what reduced my rating to 4 stars from 5 it would have otherwise received.
customer_reviews.author: RamblinMan
